New Records: Georgia became the first Georgian team to qualify for a major tournament after winning the Euro 2024 playoff final against Greece on penalties.
Key Match Events: Georgia secured a 4-2 penalty shootout win over Greece after a 0-0 draw in extra time.
Georgia's Nika Kvekveskiri converted the decisive penalty kick to send his team to Euro 2024.
Georgia goalkeeper Giorgi Mamardashvili made crucial saves in the penalty shootout.
Pre-Game Insights: Georgia manager Willy Sagnol made one change to his lineup, bringing back key forward Khvicha Kvaratskhelia from suspension.
Greece manager Gus Poyet named the same side as their 5-0 win over Kazakhstan in the semifinal.
Post-Match Reflections: Georgia's Khvicha Kvaratskhelia praised the fans, stating they were the most important factor in the team's success.
Greece's European champions status and their recent struggles were highlighted as part of the post-match narrative.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was marred by tempers flaring during halftime, with Georgia's substitute goalkeeper shown a red card.
The game was a scrappy, nervy affair with few chances in normal time.
Others: Georgia's qualification marks their first appearance in a major tournament after 14 attempts.
The match was held at Boris Paichadze Stadium in Tbilisi with an attendance of 44,000 fans.
